# [Weekly Report: On Lee] 01 February 2026 - 07 February 2026

## **Challenges & Potential Issues**
The following challenges could become potential issues if not addressed promptly.
- CATAPA Claudia, GDP Labs' First Digital Employee, aims to enhance our business by applying the technologies that GDP Labs has accumulated and developed over the past thirteen years.
  - CATAPA Claudia, a digital employee, will coordinate with the activities of the HR, IT Support, Finance, and Legal departments.
- All products:
  - Architecture, Design, and Implementation
  - Quality
  - Scalability
  - Simplicity
- GLChat and Claudia's performance for 
  - 1,000 concurrent users.
  - Gigabytes of data.
  - Different types of data: text, images, audio, and video.
- Teams - CATAPA, DevSecOps, GL-Consulting, GLAIR, HR
- Coordinate with the companies within Djarum Group, BCA Group, and GDP Venture Group.

## **Accomplishments**
- Presented [AI Engineering: Software Engineering First - AI Amplifies - Google Slides](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1uAVtGgN7cx2_rU_UTwHgZK8QR5lABVrWhF3qpxflv1w/edit?slide=id.g36c92e7990e_0_95#slide=id.g36c92e7990e_0_95) to Djarum companies
- Emailed “The GitBook Low-Code SDK Is the Final Product”

## **Meetings/Events/Training/Conferences**
- Upcoming Talks & Engagements (Jan 2026 & TBD)
  - [DONE] Monday–Tuesday, January 12–13: AI-Driven Software Development: Building Faster Without Breaking Quality — BCA Group (online)
  - [DONE] Friday, June 9, 2026 : Charoen Pokphand
  - [DONE] Tuesday, January 13, 2026: Padma, Bali
  - [DONE] Monday, Holland Bakery, January 19 and Thursday, January 22
  - [DONE] Monday, February 1 - 2, 2026: AI-Driven Software Development: Building Faster Without Breaking Quality — Djarum & GDP Venture companies
  - TBD: iForte
  - TBD: Gan Kapital (GK) Group
  - TBD: Paragon Technology
  - TBD: iSTTS (ISTTS - Institut Sains dan Teknologi Terpadu Surabaya), Surabaya
  - TBD: Petra university
  - TBD: BINUS
  - TBD: UI (Universitas Indonesia)
- Weekly reviews:
  - CATAPA
  - DevSecOps (DSO)
  - GLAIR
  - GLC - GL  Consulting
  - HR

## **Key Metrics / OMTM**
- Helping Djarum Group, BCA Group, and GDP Venture Group.

## **Next Actions**
- Continue the above

## **Technology, Business, Communication, Leadership, Management**
- [[Weekly Report: On Lee] 25 January 2026 - 31 January 2026 - Google Docs](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Z4G2iYoC-e9pKLJyukAdOHkzB-OqirVwfLrwHtKaCKk/edit?tab=t.0)

sql:
SELECT wr.*, e.name AS employee_name, o.name AS organization_name
FROM weekly_reports wr
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations o ON e.organization_id = o.id
WHERE e.name ILIKE '%On Lee%' AND wr.date = '2026-02-07'
ORDER BY wr.date DESC;

request.query:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GDP Labs%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), last_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-07' AS last_saturday
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN last_week lw
WHERE COALESCE(p.organization_id, e.organization_id) IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = lw.last_saturday
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 50;

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name AS employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) AS organization_name,
       p.name AS project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
WHERE COALESCE(p.organization_id, e.organization_id) IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = '2026-02-07'
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
 AND i.score >= 7
 AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC

input: Summarize the top 5 issues at GDP Labs last week
response:
Here are the top 5 most critical issues from GLAIR last week (week ending 2026-02-07, covering Sun 2026-02-01 to Sat 2026-02-07):

| # | Issue Description | Reporter(s) | Organization | Date | Source |
|---|-------------------|-------------|--------------|------|--------|
| 1 | The VM to hit the Fara 7B model glchat-fara7b was unable to be reached through the endpoint. | Reidolvo | GLAIR | 2026-02-07 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DU8yAQe-rMQczM4ipu8Eyd6Rhd3HdML5G7FUfIVEP08) |
| 2 | Might need to reevaluate the target and compare with the latest state in the industry | Novan Parmonangan Simanjuntak | GLAIR | 2026-02-07 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HnWvjxsG9oJB_4gGbOVH5go5lrgJxaBGlfD5pIjteIU) |
| 3 | GLChat & GL SDK Weekly Action Items Failed: GLChat & GL SDK Weekly Action Items failed to send on 6 Feb 2026 at 22:00. Daily Action Items on 6 Feb 2026 at 18:00 were delivered successfully; the issue occurred only after that time. Initial investigation suggests a possible issue related to output sharing tools or response format. Next Step: Coordinate with the AIP or Bosa team to further investigate and resolve the issue. | Jordan Hakiki Sipahutar | GLAIR | 2026-02-07 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NN3_5Ck_NZyBl_ur0avHPNh0_ueT_Lv0iv4Krq5UDLo) |
| 4 | No engineers for RnD | Felix Kurniawan Tirto, Novan Parmonangan Simanjuntak | GLAIR | 2026-02-07 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hMSrEoy5KhX3Wx2uJYUPXShNBL1dlQqUYblW-1DYv2E), [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HnWvjxsG9oJB_4gGbOVH5go5lrgJxaBGlfD5pIjteIU) |
| 5 | Many projects and requirements are coming at the same time (GLChat) | Novan Parmonangan Simanjuntak | GLAIR | 2026-02-07 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HnWvjxsG9oJB_4gGbOVH5go5lrgJxaBGlfD5pIjteIU) |

**Key Insights**:
- Highest-severity items center on GLChat availability and reliability: unreachable model endpoint (score 11) and GLChat/GL SDK delivery failures (score 7) — these are operational and likely impact users or automation flows.
- Resource and prioritization risks: "No engineers for RnD" (consolidated from 2 reports) and "Many projects/requirements arriving concurrently" indicate staffing and backlog risk that could delay fixes and improvements.
- One consolidation was performed (the "No engineers for RnD" issue combined 2 reports/ reporters into a single entry); consolidation used the most recent date and included both report links.

Would you like me to:
- drill into any of these issues (show full related weekly reports or the raw report text)?  
- expand this to the top 10 issues for GLAIR last week?

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name AS employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) AS organization_name,
       p.name AS project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
WHERE COALESCE(p.organization_id, e.organization_id) IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = '2026-02-07'
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
 AND i.score >= 7
 AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%CATAPA%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), last_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' AS last_saturday
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN last_week lw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = lw.last_saturday
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
 AND i.score >= 0
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC

request.query:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GL Consulting%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), target_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-07' AS end_date
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN target_week tw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = tw.end_date
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 100;

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%DevSecOps%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), last_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' AS last_saturday
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN last_week lw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = lw.last_saturday
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.score >=2
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
;

input: What are the top 5 issues from GLAIR last week?
response:
I have verified the data structure. Proceeding with your request.

Here are the top 5 most critical issues from GLAIR last week (week ending 2026-02-14, covering Sun 2026-02-08 to Sat 2026-02-14):

| # | Issue Description | Reporter(s) | Organization | Date | Source |
|---|-------------------|-------------|--------------|------|--------|
| 1 | **CUA**: The VM to hit the Fara 7B model glchat-fara7b was unable to be reached through the endpoint. | Reidolvo | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/164YrbR4UdXVUqng4rHRVZWEFeRHqcvuc30URzM8wIbo) |
| 2 | No engineers for RnD | Felix Kurniawan Tirto | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JJqdqVyuN1rLdnM9_vyY3jzhuyJyNAnXTwGowqPCMc8) |
| 3 | Long processing time for a simple query in the Standard RAG pipeline-based chatbot GLChat; Might need to reevaluate the target and compare with the latest state in the industry | Felix Kurniawan Tirto | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JJqdqVyuN1rLdnM9_vyY3jzhuyJyNAnXTwGowqPCMc8) |
| 4 | **[WIP] Weekly report agent and Github agent are not properly handling GDP Labs’ use cases.** AIP team will supervise the enhancement, the PIC will be Faiz and Douglas. The PM will be handled by Claudia's team, Dennis. | Reinhart Linanda | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p_jLf6DoZG7caX4wzpSZR2B9oxv2LVd9sOIezEfEnQI) |
| 5 | **[Potential Issues] Djarum Beebot Universe**: Djarum Universe (Beebot, SR/GRI, Common Mistake) is forked from GLChat, so every GLChat version update requires additional time and resources to maintain compatibility. Each upgrade currently impacts **8 pipelines** and involves **3 AIEs** and **1 SDE**, creating significant overhead. In addition, despite using standard RAG, Beebot still encounters major breaking changes after GLChat upgrades, requiring extra time for re-adjustment and validation. (Consolidated from multiple reporters) | Moch. Nauval Rizaldi Nasril, Resti Febriana, Jordan Hakiki Sipahutar, Vincent | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MQp6tcQq6D1RSPRgd_jiPQPdEBVDl0em48cXNJnz0cM), [View Report 2](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19UgmLc_7KwzU8KA3o-DX5qESULe0JgELFOZiU5dXG5c), [View Report 3](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-lWtE51kO0pNeKwXbbO674XhP1QOp3EJjmSbteC51EQ), [View Report 4](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19eZ85pWEBbxOQ6JK7Aqb6eeYF-v4if61SovrHRwdOSQ) |

**Key Insights**:
- The single highest-priority operational blocker is the CUA → Fara7B endpoint outage (score 11). This is likely production-impacting and requires immediate availability and root-cause investigation.
- Resource constraints are explicit: “No engineers for RnD” (score 7) indicates staffing bottlenecks that will slow fixes and improvements across multiple AIP/GLChat initiatives.
- A recurring maintenance/compatibility burden (Djarum Beebot Universe) was reported by multiple teams (5 reports consolidated into one entry). This is a systemic cost: upgrades to GLChat create repeated rework across pipelines and teams and should be addressed with a coordinated solution (shared components or feature support).
- Performance concerns (long processing time in the RAG pipeline) and integration fragility (weekly-report/GitHub agent limitations) together point to both infrastructure and product-design work needed to meet performance and scaling targets.

Would you like me to:
- open a follow-up that lists all reporters and full report links for each consolidated issue (so we can assign owners), or
- run a recurrence check to see if these exact issues appeared in prior weeks?

The SQA issue metric for the catapa-time-management frontend component improved from 1,390 to 1,373, indicating fewer issues, while code coverage for this component increased slightly from 97.21% to 97.23%. A minor customer-reported bug was logged this month, up from zero previously. Over the past week, I worked on refactoring policy modules, reviewing attendance and shift pattern PRs, implementing UI improvements, and addressing mobile app feedback. For the upcoming week, I plan to continue reviewing PRs and tackling backlogs, with a focus on the transition to CATAPA Mobile Apps.

request.query:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name AS reporter, COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) AS organization_name,
       p.name AS project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url, i.weekly_report_id
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = '2026-02-14'
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC;

**Key Insights**:

- Resource constraints are explicit: “No engineers for RnD” (score 7) indicates staffing bottlenecks that will slow fixes and improvements across multiple AIP/GLChat initiatives.
- A recurring maintenance/compatibility burden (Djarum Beebot Universe) was reported by multiple teams (5 reports consolidated into one entry). This is a systemic cost: upgrades to GLChat create repeated rework across pipelines and teams and should be addressed with a coordinated solution (shared components or feature support).
- Performance concerns (long processing time in the RAG pipeline) and integration fragility (weekly-report/GitHub agent limitations) together point to both infrastructure and product-design work needed to meet performance and scaling targets.

- open a follow-up that lists all reporters and full report links for each consolidated issue (so we can assign owners), or
- run a recurrence check to see if these exact issues appeared in prior weeks?

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN (SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' as target_date) td
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = td.target_date
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 5;

request.query:
SELECT
    e.employee_name,
    i.issue_text,
    i.issue_priority,
    i.report_id,
    wr.report_date,
    wr.report_url,
    COALESCE(po.organization_name, eo.organization_name) as organization_name
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
WHERE eo.organization_name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
  AND wr.report_date = '2026-02-14'
  AND i.issue_text IS NOT NULL
  AND TRIM(i.issue_text) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.issue_priority DESC, wr.report_date DESC
LIMIT 5;

request.query:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN (SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' as target_date) td
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = td.target_date
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 100;

)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i

JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id

LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN (SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' as target_date) td

  AND i.score IS NOT NULL

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN (SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' as target_date) td
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = td.target_date
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 5;

request.query:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%DevSecOps%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), last_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' AS last_saturday
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN last_week lw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = lw.last_saturday
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 20;

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%DevSecOps%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), last_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' AS last_saturday
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN last_week lw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = lw.last_saturday
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.score >=2
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
;

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%CATAPA%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
), last_week AS (
    SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' AS last_saturday
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN last_week lw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = lw.last_saturday
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
 AND i.score >= 0
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC

input: What are the top 5 issues from GLAIR last week?
response:
Here are the top 5 most critical issues from GLAIR (week ending 2026-02-14 — last week):

| # | Issue Description | Reporter(s) | Organization | Date | Source |
|---|-------------------|-------------|--------------|------|--------|
| 1 | **CUA**: The VM to hit the Fara 7B model glchat-fara7b was unable to be reached through the endpoint. | Reidolvo | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/164YrbR4UdXVUqng4rHRVZWEFeRHqcvuc30URzM8wIbo) |
| 2 | No engineers for RnD | Felix Kurniawan Tirto | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JJqdqVyuN1rLdnM9_vyY3jzhuyJyNAnXTwGowqPCMc8) |
| 3 | Long processing time for a simple query in the Standard RAG pipeline-based chatbot GLChat; Might need to reevaluate the target and compare with the latest state in the industry | Felix Kurniawan Tirto | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JJqdqVyuN1rLdnM9_vyY3jzhuyJyNAnXTwGowqPCMc8) |
| 4 | **[WIP] Weekly report agent and Github agent are not properly handling GDP Labs’ use cases.** AIP team will supervise the enhancement, the PIC will be Faiz and Douglas. The PM will be handled by Claudia's team, Dennis. | Reinhart Linanda | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p_jLf6DoZG7caX4wzpSZR2B9oxv2LVd9sOIezEfEnQI) |
| 5 | **[Potential Issues] Djarum Beebot Universe**: Djarum Universe (Beebot, SR/GRI, Common Mistake) is forked from GLChat, so every GLChat version update requires additional time and resources to maintain compatibility. Each upgrade currently impacts **8 pipelines** and involves **3 AIEs** and **1 SDE**, creating significant overhead. In addition, despite using standard RAG, Beebot still encounters major breaking changes after GLChat upgrades, requiring extra time for re-adjustment and validation. (Consolidated reports) | Moch. Nauval Rizaldi Nasril, Resti Febriana, Jordan Hakiki Sipahutar, Vincent | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MQp6tcQq6D1RSPRgd_jiPQPdEBVDl0em48cXNJnz0cM), [View Report 2](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-lWtE51kO0pNeKwXbbO674XhP1QOp3EJjmSbteC51EQ), [View Report 3](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19UgmLc_7KwzU8KA3o-DX5qESULe0JgELFOZiU5dXG5c), [View Report 4](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19eZ85pWEBbxOQ6JK7Aqb6eeYF-v4if61SovrHRwdOSQ) |

**Key Insights**:
- Infrastructure and availability (VM / model endpoint) was the single highest-severity item (score 11) and likely needs immediate ops attention to restore reliable access to Fara 7B.
- Staffing and capacity problems (no engineers for RnD) are high priority (score 7) and appear to be causing downstream impacts: performance tuning, backlog of GLChat requests, and maintenance overhead for forks like Beebot.
- Multiple reporters raised the same maintenance/compatibility problem with Djarum/Beebot (consolidated into one entry). This is a cross-cutting engineering/maintenance cost issue that would benefit from a shared-platform approach (e.g., upstreaming common components into GLChat or formalizing compatibility/support SLAs).

Would you like me to:
- drill into the individual reports for any of these issues and extract suggested action items and owners; or
- check whether these issues recurred in the surrounding weeks (trend/recurrence analysis)?

    SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' AS end_date
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN target_week tw
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = tw.end_date
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 100;

| 3 | Long processing time for a simple query in the Standard RAG pipeline-based chatbot GLChat; Might need to reevaluate the target and compare with the latest state in the industry | Felix Kurniawan Tirto | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JJqdqVyuN1rLdnM9_vyY3jzhuyJyNAnXTwGowqPCMc8) |
| 4 | **[WIP] Weekly report agent and Github agent are not properly handling GDP Labs’ use cases.** AIP team will supervise the enhancement, the PIC will be Faiz and Douglas. The PM will be handled by Claudia's team, Dennis. | Reinhart Linanda | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p_jLf6DoZG7caX4wzpSZR2B9oxv2LVd9sOIezEfEnQI) |
| 5 | **[Potential Issues] Djarum Beebot Universe**: Djarum Universe (Beebot, SR/GRI, Common Mistake) is forked from GLChat, so every GLChat version update requires additional time and resources to maintain compatibility. Each upgrade currently impacts **8 pipelines** and involves **3 AIEs** and **1 SDE**, creating significant overhead. In addition, despite using standard RAG, Beebot still encounters major breaking changes after GLChat upgrades, requiring extra time for re-adjustment and validation. (Consolidated reports) | Moch. Nauval Rizaldi Nasril, Resti Febriana, Jordan Hakiki Sipahutar, Vincent | GLAIR | 2026-02-14 | [View Report 1](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MQp6tcQq6D1RSPRgd_jiPQPdEBVDl0em48cXNJnz0cM), [View Report 2](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-lWtE51kO0pNeKwXbbO674XhP1QOp3EJjmSbteC51EQ), [View Report 3](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19UgmLc_7KwzU8KA3o-DX5qESULe0JgELFOZiU5dXG5c), [View Report 4](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19eZ85pWEBbxOQ6JK7Aqb6eeYF-v4if61SovrHRwdOSQ) |

**Key Insights**:
- Infrastructure and availability (VM / model endpoint) was the single highest-severity item (score 11) and likely needs immediate ops attention to restore reliable access to Fara 7B.
- Staffing and capacity problems (no engineers for RnD) are high priority (score 7) and appear to be causing downstream impacts: performance tuning, backlog of GLChat requests, and maintenance overhead for forks like Beebot.
- Multiple reporters raised the same maintenance/compatibility problem with Djarum/Beebot (consolidated into one entry). This is a cross-cutting engineering/maintenance cost issue that would benefit from a shared-platform approach (e.g., upstreaming common components into GLChat or formalizing compatibility/support SLAs).

Would you like me to:
- drill into the individual reports for any of these issues and extract suggested action items and owners; or
- check whether these issues recurred in the surrounding weeks (trend/recurrence analysis)?

sql:
WITH RECURSIVE org_tree AS (
    SELECT id FROM organizations WHERE name ILIKE '%GLAIR%'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT o.id FROM organizations o JOIN org_tree ot ON o.parent_organization_id = ot.id
)
SELECT i.id, i.issue, i.score, e.name as employee_name,
       COALESCE(po.name, eo.name) as organization_name,
       p.name as project_name, wr.date, wr.docs_url
FROM issues i
JOIN weekly_reports wr ON i.weekly_report_id = wr.id
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations eo ON e.organization_id = eo.id
LEFT JOIN projects p ON i.project_id = p.id
LEFT JOIN organizations po ON p.organization_id = po.id
CROSS JOIN (SELECT DATE '2026-02-14' as target_date) td
WHERE e.organization_id IN (SELECT id FROM org_tree)
  AND wr.date = td.target_date
  AND i.score IS NOT NULL
  AND i.issue IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(i.issue) NOT IN ('', 'None', '- None', '-', '- -')
ORDER BY i.score DESC, wr.date DESC
LIMIT 5;

SELECT
    wr.id,
    wr.date,
    e.name as employee_name,
    o.name as organization_name,
    wr.accomplishments,

WHERE e.name ILIKE '%On Lee%'
  AND wr.date = '2026-02-14'
ORDER BY wr.date DESC;

SELECT
    wr.id,
    wr.date,
    e.name as employee_name,
    o.name as organization_name,
    wr.accomplishments,
    wr.issues,
    wr.meetings_events,
    wr.key_metrics,
    wr.next_actions,
    wr.learnings,
    wr.out_of_office,
    wr.docs_url,
    wr.raw_weekly_report
FROM weekly_reports wr
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations o ON e.organization_id = o.id
WHERE e.name ILIKE '%On Lee%'
  AND wr.date >= '2026-01-01'
  AND wr.date <= '2026-01-31'
ORDER BY wr.date DESC;

ground_truth.accomplishments:
- Emailed “Why Creating a GitBook Low-Code SDK & User Guide Matters”
  - Algorithms + Data Structures = Programs.
  - AI Agent = Agentic Dynamic Pipeline + Capability + Memory
  - Deep Research = Research Dynamic Pipeline + AI Agents
  - Final Takeaway
    - Wirth’s lesson was that composition is where power comes from.
    - Software scaled because we mastered algorithms + data structures
    - AI agents scale because we master agent pipelines + capabilities + memory
    - Deep research scales because we master research pipelines + multi-agent orchestration
    - Composition is the foundation.
- Presented [AI Engineering: Software Engineering First, AI Amplifies & Extends - Google Slides](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1uAVtGgN7cx2_rU_UTwHgZK8QR5lABVrWhF3qpxflv1w/edit) to BCA engineering team.

sql:
SELECT
    wr.id,
    wr.date,
    e.name as employee_name,
    o.name as organization_name,
    wr.accomplishments,
    wr.issues,
    wr.meetings_events,
    wr.key_metrics,
    wr.next_actions,
    wr.learnings,
    wr.out_of_office,
    wr.docs_url,
    wr.raw_weekly_report
FROM weekly_reports wr
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations o ON e.organization_id = o.id
WHERE e.name ILIKE '%On Lee%'
  AND wr.date >= '2026-01-01'
  AND wr.date <= '2026-01-31'
ORDER BY wr.date DESC;

ground_truth.accomplishments:
- Emailed “Why Creating a GitBook Low-Code SDK & User Guide Matters”
  - Algorithms + Data Structures = Programs.
  - AI Agent = Agentic Dynamic Pipeline + Capability + Memory
  - Deep Research = Research Dynamic Pipeline + AI Agents
  - Final Takeaway
    - Wirth’s lesson was that composition is where power comes from.
    - Software scaled because we mastered algorithms + data structures
    - AI agents scale because we master agent pipelines + capabilities + memory
    - Deep research scales because we master research pipelines + multi-agent orchestration
    - Composition is the foundation.

sql:
SELECT
    wr.id,
    wr.date,
    e.name as employee_name,
    o.name as organization_name,
    wr.accomplishments,
    wr.issues,
    wr.meetings_events,
    wr.key_metrics,
    wr.next_actions,
    wr.learnings,
    wr.out_of_office,
    wr.docs_url,
    wr.raw_weekly_report
FROM weekly_reports wr
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations o ON e.organization_id = o.id
WHERE e.name ILIKE '%On Lee%'
  AND wr.date >= '2026-01-01'
  AND wr.date <= '2026-01-31'
ORDER BY wr.date DESC;

sql:
SELECT
    wr.id,
    wr.date,
    e.name as employee_name,
    o.name as organization_name,
    wr.accomplishments,
    wr.issues,
    wr.meetings_events,
    wr.key_metrics,
    wr.next_actions,
    wr.learnings,
    wr.out_of_office,
    wr.docs_url
FROM weekly_reports wr
JOIN employees e ON wr.employee_id = e.id
JOIN organizations o ON e.organization_id = o.id
WHERE e.name ILIKE '%On Lee%'
  AND wr.date = '2026-02-14'
ORDER BY wr.date DESC;
